results_summary: Both peanuts and almonds, when included in a low-carbohydrate diet, similarly improved fasting and postprandial blood glucose in T2DM patients. Almonds showed a significant reduction in HbA1c levels compared to baseline, but no significant difference was found between the peanut and almond groups after three months.
population_specificity: 32 patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus (17 in the Peanut group, 15 in the Almond group).
effective_dosage: Not specified (part of starchy staple food replaced with peanuts or almonds).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether soaking almonds (activation) reduces phytic acid (InsP6) content, thereby potentially enhancing nutrient bioavailability.
results_summary: Soaking almonds for 24 hours reduced InsP6 content by 4.75%, a statistically significant but modest decrease. The study suggests activation may slightly improve nutrient bioavailability, but the effect is limited.
population_specificity: Not specified (likely general almonds as a food product).
effective_dosage: Soaking for 12-24 hours at room temperature, sometimes followed by 24-hour drying at 50 ± 5°C.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the acute effects of an almond diet on endothelial function compared to a walnut diet, focusing on changes in vascular inflammation and endothelial dysfunction.
results_summary: The almond diet showed a tendency to improve flow-mediated dilation (FMD) (p=0.06) and significantly decreased soluble vascular cell adhesion molecules (sVCAM) (p=0.004), indicating potential cardiovascular benefits. No significant difference was found between the almond and walnut diets in improving these markers.
population_specificity: Twenty-seven overweight volunteers
effective_dosage: Not specified (diet provided 7.6% energy from PUFA)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the individual and combined effects of almonds, dark chocolate, and cocoa on markers of coronary heart disease risk in overweight and obese individuals.
results_summary: Almond consumption alone reduced total cholesterol, non-HDL cholesterol, and LDL cholesterol by 4%, 5%, and 7%, respectively. Combined with dark chocolate, almonds also reduced apolipoprotein B by 5% and small dense LDL particles by 12.0 mg/dL compared to the average American diet.
population_specificity: Overweight and obese individuals aged 30 to 70 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether adding ~60g/d of almonds to a controlled diet (NCEP step II) would improve glucoregulation and cardiovascular disease risk factors in Chinese patients with type 2 diabetes.
results_summary: Almonds did not significantly improve glycemic status or most CVD risk factors, except for reducing circulating nitric oxide. However, in patients with baseline HbA1c ≤8, almonds decreased fasting serum glucose by 5.9% and HbA1c by 3.0% compared to the control diet.
population_specificity: 33 Chinese patients with type 2 diabetes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the chemopreventive potential of in vitro-fermented almonds, particularly assessing the impact of different roasting conditions on their effects in LT97 colon adenoma cells.
results_summary: Fermentation supernatants of raw and roasted almonds showed no genotoxic effects, increased mRNA levels of antioxidant enzymes, reduced LT97 cell growth, and induced apoptosis. The chemopreventive effects were largely independent of roasting conditions.
population_specificity: LT97 colon adenoma cells (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of consuming almonds versus a baked food on postprandial appetite and neural responses to visual food stimuli in adults undergoing a weight loss intervention.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in postprandial hunger, desire to eat, fullness, or neural responses between almonds and the baked food, nor did weight loss influence these outcomes. The results suggest that energy and macronutrient content, rather than a unique satiety effect of almonds, primarily determine postprandial appetite.
population_specificity: 22 adults (19 women, 3 men) with a BMI between 25 and 40 kg/m² participating in a 12-week behavioral weight loss intervention.
effective_dosage: 28 g of whole, lightly salted roasted almonds per serving.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of radio-frequency (RF) heating versus conventional convective heating in reducing Salmonella pathogens in raw shelled almonds and assess its impact on almond quality.
results_summary: RF heating achieved significantly higher log reductions of Salmonella pathogens (both surface and internal) compared to conventional heating, with no significant changes in color or lipid oxidation. RF heating was more effective and faster, reducing pathogens below detection limits in 30-40 seconds.
population_specificity: Raw shelled almonds inoculated with Salmonella enterica serovars (Enteritidis, Typhimurium, Senftenberg).
effective_dosage: RF heating for 30-40 seconds; conventional heating for 600 seconds.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of microbial reduction treatment levels (1 to 5 log CFU) on the risk of human salmonellosis from almond consumption in the United States.
results_summary: A 3-log reduction treatment resulted in a predicted mean risk of illness of two cases per year for almonds consumed as a core product not cooked at home, one case per year for almonds consumed as an ingredient not cooked at home, and less than one case per year for almonds cooked at home. A minimum 4-log reduction treatment resulted in an estimated mean risk of illness below one case per year in the United States.
population_specificity: Almond consumers in the United States.
effective_dosage: Not specified (microbial reduction treatment levels of 1 to 5 log CFU).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how different processing methods (raw, stir-fried, scalded) affect the amygdalin profile in bitter almonds from three producing areas in China.
results_summary: The study identified amygdalin, neoamygdalin, and amygdalin amide in processed bitter almonds, with amygdalin levels influenced by processing methods. It also suggested that amygdalin isomer levels could classify different processed bitter almonds.
population_specificity: Not specified (focused on almond samples from three producing areas in China).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the disinfecting properties of high-intensity monochromatic blue light (MBL) against pathogenic and nonpathogenic bacteria on almonds and assess the potential of nonpathogenic strains as surrogates.
results_summary: MBL treatment reduced pathogenic and nonpathogenic bacteria on almonds, with log reductions ranging from 0.54 to 2.44 CFU/g. Nonpathogenic strains responded similarly to their pathogenic counterparts, suggesting their utility as surrogates. The process remained nonthermal, with temperatures below ambient.
population_specificity: Almonds inoculated with Escherichia coli O157:H7, Salmonella, and nonpathogenic strains.
effective_dosage: MBL exposure times of 0, 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, and 10 minutes at a working distance of 7 cm.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of phenyl propionate lures and PPO-combo lures in monitoring navel orangeworm in almond and pistachio fields under mating disruption.
results_summary: The study found that phenyl propionate lures and PPO-combo lures effectively captured navel orangeworm adults even in the presence of mating disruption, with no failure of detection observed. The ratio of adults captured varied with proximity to treated fields, but PPO-combo lures outperformed pheromone lures in detection reliability.
population_specificity: Almond and pistachio fields in California affected by navel orangeworm.
study_duration: Six weeks (useful life of phenyl propionate dispensers)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of Gear Up/Throttle Down (GUTD) and Inward Only spray strategies versus conventional airblast applications in reducing spray drift and controlling navel orangeworm (NOW) in almonds.
results_summary: Conventional treatment resulted in the highest spray drift (15.6% of bifenthrin load), while GUTD and Inward Only reduced drift to 7.6% and 9.7%, respectively. NOW control was lower for Inward Only compared to GUTD and conventional treatments, particularly at higher canopy levels (4.88 m).
population_specificity: Almond orchards (specifically targeting navel orangeworm at hull split treatment timing).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if near-infrared (NIR) spectroscopy could effectively detect concealed damage (CD) in raw almonds, which becomes visible only after heat treatment.
results_summary: The study demonstrated that NIR spectroscopy, combined with partial least squares discriminant analysis (PLS-DA), could detect CD in almonds with false-positive and false-negative error rates ranging between 12.4-16.1% and 10.6-17.2%, respectively. Second-derivative preprocessing of selected wavelengths yielded the most robust predictive model.
population_specificity: Almond kernels (no human or animal subjects specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether consuming almonds improves immune status, diet quality, microbiota composition, and gastrointestinal function in parents and their children.
results_summary: Almond consumption improved diet quality in both parents and children and induced genus-level changes in microbiota, particularly in children, but did not significantly affect immune markers or gastrointestinal symptoms.
population_specificity: 29 parent-child pairs (parents aged 35 ± 0.6 years; children aged 4 ± 0.2 years).
effective_dosage: Parents: 1.5 oz almonds/almond butter daily; children: 0.5 oz almonds/almond butter daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to test the impact of almonds consumed as a snack on cardiovascular risk factors in overweight/obese Korean adults following a typical Korean diet.
results_summary: Almonds increased intake of MUFA, PUFA, vitamin E, and dietary fiber while reducing carbohydrate energy. They also improved plasma α-tocopherol status and reduced total cholesterol, LDL-C, and non-HDL-C, but did not affect body weight or inflammatory markers significantly.
population_specificity: Overweight/obese Korean adults (84 participants, 11 males and 73 females, mean age 52.4 years).
study_duration: Two 4-week intervention phases with a 2-week washout period.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to test whether almond supplementation could increase HDL cholesterol in CAD patients with low baseline HDL levels.
results_summary: Almonds significantly increased HDL cholesterol by 12-16% and improved other lipid markers, with no differences between Pakistani and American almond varieties. No changes were observed in dietary patterns, body weight, or blood pressure.
population_specificity: CAD patients with LDL ≤100 mg/dL and low HDL (≤40 mg/dL in men, ≤50 mg/dL in women).
effective_dosage: 10 g/day, consumed before breakfast after soaking overnight and removing the skin.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of superheated steam (SHS) in inactivating foodborne pathogens on almonds and pistachios and to assess its impact on product quality.
results_summary: SHS treatment at 200 °C for 15s or 30s achieved >5 log reductions in pathogens without significantly altering color or texture, while maintaining acceptable acid and peroxide values. The method proved effective for pathogen inactivation without compromising nut quality.
population_specificity: Almonds and in-shell pistachios inoculated with foodborne pathogens (E. coli O157:H7, Salmonella Typhimurium, Salmonella Enteritidis PT 30, and Listeria monocytogenes).
effective_dosage: SHS treatment at 125, 150, 175, and 200 °C for various times (15s or 30s at 200 °C).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of adding 100 g of almonds daily to background statin therapy on lipid profiles, LDL-C particle size, and lipoprotein (a) over 4 weeks.
results_summary: The almond group showed a significant 4.9% reduction in non-HDL-C compared to a 3.5% increase in the non-almond group, with notable but non-significant improvements in LDL-C and triglycerides. A shift from LDL pattern A to B particles was also observed in the almond group.
population_specificity: 48 subjects receiving consistent statin therapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a fast, non-destructive method using NIR spectroscopy to discriminate between sweet and bitter almonds.
results_summary: The study successfully discriminated sweet and bitter almonds using NIR spectroscopy coupled with chemometrics, achieving over 95% correct classification. Raman spectroscopy validated the results, confirming the method's accuracy.
population_specificity: Almond kernels (Prunus amygdalus).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how pollination and resource availability (water and fertilizer) influence the nutritional composition of almonds, specifically fat and vitamin E content.
results_summary: Pollination significantly affected almond nutritional quality, with self-pollinated trees producing less desirable fat profiles (lower oleic to linoleic acid ratios) but higher vitamin E levels. Combined changes in pollination and resource availability sometimes amplified these effects.
population_specificity: Almond trees in an orchard in northern California.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of a hypocaloric almond-enriched diet versus a nut-free diet on weight loss and cardiovascular risk factors in overweight and obese women.
results_summary: The almond-enriched diet led to greater weight loss and improvements in cardiovascular risk factors (e.g., cholesterol, blood pressure) compared to the nut-free diet, though the nut-free group showed better LDL-C and systolic blood pressure reductions.
population_specificity: Overweight and obese women (BMI >25).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the mechanistic basis for the cardiovascular benefits of almonds, focusing on cholesterol synthesis inhibition, hepatic protection, and vascular function restoration.
results_summary: Almond supplementation significantly prevented hyperlipidemia, inhibited cholesterol synthesis, protected against hepatic damage, and restored vascular function by promoting nitric oxide release and preventing endothelial dysfunction. It also normalized serum and LDL cholesterol levels in rat models.
population_specificity: Rats (three groups with different induced conditions: tyloxapol, high-fat diet, and white-flour fructose).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the nootropic effects of almonds and their impact on food intake and plasma cholesterol levels in rats.
results_summary: Almond-treated rats showed significant improvement in learning and memory, reduced food intake, and lower plasma cholesterol levels, with enhanced brain tryptophan and serotonergic turnover.
population_specificity: Rats
effective_dosage: Almond paste administered orally via feeding tube (specific dosage not detailed)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of almonds on postprandial glycemia, appetite, short-term body weight, and fasting blood parameters when consumed with meals or as a standalone snack.
results_summary: Almonds lowered postprandial glucose responses, particularly when consumed as snacks, and reduced hunger and desire to eat. After 4 weeks, no significant differences in body weight or fasting blood parameters were observed, and daily energy intake adjusted to compensate for almond consumption.
population_specificity: 137 participants with an increased risk for type 2 diabetes.
effective_dosage: 43 g/day (consumed with breakfast, lunch, or as a morning/afternoon snack).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the accurate energy value of almonds in the human diet and compare it with the value calculated using the Atwater factors.
results_summary: The study found that the metabolizable energy content of almonds was 4.6 kcal/g, significantly lower than the 6.0-6.1 kcal/g estimated by Atwater factors, indicating a 32% overestimation. The results highlight inaccuracies in the Atwater factors for almonds.
population_specificity: Eighteen healthy adults.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of almond consumption versus sunflower kernel consumption on lipid and lipoprotein markers of cardiovascular disease in postmenopausal women with type 2 diabetes.
results_summary: Almond consumption led to significant reductions in total cholesterol (TC) and low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) from baseline, with no significant difference compared to sunflower kernels. However, sunflower kernels resulted in a significant reduction in HDL-C, TAG, and apolipoproteins A1 and B100 compared to almonds. Both diets showed clinically beneficial effects on CVD risk markers.
population_specificity: Postmenopausal women with type 2 diabetes (n=22).
study_duration: Two periods of three weeks each, separated by a four-week washout.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if enzymatic treatment could improve the quality of poor-quality cocoa almonds by generating chocolate flavor precursors.
results_summary: The study found that microbial enzymes could generate compounds in poor-quality almonds that, after roasting, produce characteristic chocolate flavor, though optimization of treatment conditions is needed for industrial use.
population_specificity: Poor-quality cocoa almonds affected by witches' broom disease, primarily from African imports used in Brazil.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the phytochemical content of tree nuts, including almonds, and their bioactivity and health benefits in humans.
results_summary: The study found that tree nuts, including almonds, contain various phytochemicals with antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, and other health-promoting properties, though data on bioaccessibility and bioavailability from intervention trials are limited.
population_specificity: Not specified (general human population implied)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the survival and heat resistance of Salmonella Enteritidis PT 30 on almonds stored at different temperatures and durations.
results_summary: Salmonella levels declined by 0.5 and 2.1 log CFU/g at 4 and 23 °C, respectively, over 48 weeks. Heat treatment in oil at 121 °C effectively reduced Salmonella, with faster reductions at higher storage temperatures.
population_specificity: Nonpareil variety almonds inoculated with Salmonella Enteritidis PT 30.
effective_dosage: Not applicable (study focused on heat treatment duration: 0.5 to 2.5 min).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of rapid cold plasma treatments in eliminating Salmonella and Escherichia coli O157:H7 from dry almonds.
results_summary: Cold plasma significantly reduced both pathogens on almonds, with the greatest reduction being a 1.34 log cfu/mL reduction of E. coli O157:H7 C9490 after 20 s treatment at 6 cm spacing. The antimicrobial efficacy varied based on treatment time, distance from the emitter, and feed gas, with nitrogen generally being less effective than dry air.
population_specificity: Dry almonds inoculated with Salmonella and E. coli O157:H7.
effective_dosage: Treatment times of 0 s (control), 10 s, or 20 s; distances of 2, 4, or 6 cm from the emitter; feed gases of dry air or nitrogen.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of various sanitizers and heat treatments in reducing Salmonella populations on raw almonds.
results_summary: Sanitizer treatment alone was ineffective, but combined with infrared drying, it reduced Salmonella by 2.73 log CFU/g. Hot water treatment followed by infrared drying reduced pathogens to undetectable levels by direct plating.
population_specificity: Raw almonds inoculated with Salmonella.
effective_dosage: Various treatments (e.g., dry heat at 60°C for 4 days, hot water at 85°C for 40 seconds, IR drying for 70 seconds).
study_duration: Varies by treatment (e.g., 4 days for dry heat, 40 seconds for hot water).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effectiveness of superheated steam (SHS) followed by catalytic infrared (IR) heat treatment in inactivating Salmonella on raw almonds and to evaluate the impact on almond quality.
results_summary: The combined SHS (70 seconds) and catalytic IR (70 seconds) treatment reduced Salmonella by 5.73 log CFU/g with no survivors detected, while maintaining acceptable visual quality in treated almonds.
population_specificity: Raw almonds contaminated with Salmonella.
effective_dosage: 70 seconds SHS followed by 70 seconds catalytic IR heat treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether almonds improve carbohydrate metabolism, providing an additional explanation for their association with reduced coronary heart disease risk.
results_summary: The study found that almonds significantly reduced 24-hour insulin secretion compared to the control, suggesting a metabolic advantage that may contribute to lower CHD risk. No differences were observed in fasting glucose, insulin, or insulin resistance measures.
population_specificity: 27 hyperlipidemic men and women
effective_dosage: Full-dose almonds (73 ± 3 g/d) and half-dose almonds (combined with muffins)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of different pheromone dispensing systems and insecticides in reducing navel orangeworm damage in almonds and pistachios.
results_summary: In almonds, mating disruption with gridded Puffers or hand-applied devices reduced navel orangeworm damage by approximately 37% (not significant), while peripheral Puffers resulted in a 16% reduction. In 2004, Puffers alone, insecticide alone, and their combination significantly reduced damage in Nonpareil almonds, but mating disruption alone was ineffective in later-harvested varieties.
population_specificity: Navel orangeworm (Amyelois transitella) in Nonpareil almonds and pistachios.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the dose-response effects of almonds on oxidative stress markers and lipid peroxidation in hyperlipidemic subjects compared to a control diet.
results_summary: Full-dose almonds reduced serum malondialdehyde (MDA) and urinary isoprostane output, indicating antioxidant activity, but did not affect tocopherol levels. Almonds also showed greater weight loss compared to the control at half-dose.
population_specificity: 27 hyperlipidemic men and women
effective_dosage: Full-dose almonds (73 ± 3 g/d), half-dose almonds plus half-dose muffins

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of high hydrostatic water pressure treatments in reducing Salmonella Enteritidis contamination on raw almonds.
results_summary: The study found that high hydrostatic water pressure treatments (414 and 483 MPa) combined with drying at elevated temperatures (55°C to 115°C) significantly reduced Salmonella Enteritidis levels on raw almonds, achieving undetectable levels or log reductions exceeding 3.58. Increasing pressure and drying temperature further enhanced the reduction.
population_specificity: Raw almonds inoculated with Salmonella Enteritidis strains PT 9c and PT 30.
effective_dosage: 414 MPa and 483 MPa for 6 min, followed by drying at 55°C to 115°C for 5 to 25 min.
study_duration: Single treatment session (6 min pressurization + drying time).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether daily consumption of a 1440 kJ serving of almonds leads to positive energy balance and changes in body composition.
results_summary: Ten weeks of daily almond consumption did not cause weight gain, primarily due to compensatory reductions in other food intake and inefficient energy absorption from almonds. No changes in metabolic measures were observed.
population_specificity: Twenty women.
effective_dosage: 1440 kJ (approximately 344 kcal) serving of almonds daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of nonthermal plasma (NTP) technology in reducing E. coli contamination on almonds.
results_summary: NTP treatment achieved a nearly 5-log reduction of E. coli on almonds after 30 seconds at 30 kV and 2000 Hz, with efficacy increasing at higher voltages and frequencies. The reduction followed first-order kinetics, with varying rates depending on almond type and grade, and E. coli in the logarithmic phase was more sensitive to NTP.
population_specificity: Almonds artificially contaminated with E. coli.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the risk of salmonellosis from raw almond consumption and evaluate risk reduction methods, including a 5-log reduction process and propylene oxide treatment.
results_summary: The study found a 78% annual risk of salmonellosis from raw almonds, which was reduced to less than 1% with a 5-log reduction process or commercial propylene oxide treatment.
population_specificity: Not specified (general U.S. population implied).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether almonds could lower postprandial glucose excursions and reduce oxidative protein damage compared to other carbohydrate-rich foods.
results_summary: Almonds reduced glycemic index and postprandial insulin response compared to instant mashed potatoes, and increased serum protein thiol concentration, indicating less oxidative protein damage. These effects suggest almonds may lower oxidative damage risk by moderating glucose spikes and providing antioxidants.
population_specificity: Fifteen healthy subjects
effective_dosage: Not specified (balanced meals with almonds, bread, rice, or potatoes)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of steam treatment in reducing Salmonella Enteritidis on the surface of raw almonds, comparing two cultivars ('Nonpareil' and 'Mission').
results_summary: Steam treatment significantly reduced Salmonella Enteritidis on raw almonds, with greater reductions observed with longer treatment times. 'Nonpareil' almonds showed higher sensitivity to steam treatment compared to 'Mission' almonds, indicating varietal differences in pathogen resistance.
population_specificity: Raw almonds (cultivars 'Nonpareil' and 'Mission') inoculated with Salmonella Enteritidis.
effective_dosage: Steam treatment at 93°C ± 1°C for durations of 5, 15, 25, 35, 45, 55, and 65 seconds.
study_duration: Single treatment session with varying exposure times.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of propylene oxide (PPO) treatment in reducing Salmonella Enteritidis PT 30 on bulk raw almonds.
results_summary: PPO treatment consistently reduced Salmonella Enteritidis PT 30 populations by >5.0 log CFU/g, with further reductions during post-PPO storage. Holding almonds at higher temperatures post-treatment did not significantly improve reductions.
population_specificity: Bulk raw almonds inoculated with Salmonella Enteritidis PT 30.
study_duration: Treatment duration was 4 hours, followed by 0-2 days at 38-43°C and 2-5 days at 15-18°C.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare oxalate absorption from almonds and black beans and evaluate methods for assessing oxalate absorption.
results_summary: Almonds showed significantly higher oxalate absorption (5.9%) compared to black beans (1.8%) using the oxalate load method, but no significant difference was found with extrinsically labeled oxalate. The study suggests soluble and insoluble oxalate content in food influences absorption.
population_specificity: 6 male and 5 female subjects

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a diet combining almonds with other cholesterol-lowering components (portfolio diet) could reduce LDL-C levels similarly to statins.
results_summary: The portfolio diet, which included almonds, significantly reduced LDL-C by 35.0% and improved the LDL:HDL-C ratio by 30.0%, outperforming the low-fat control diet. No adverse effects or differences in blood pressure, HDL-C, triglycerides, or other markers were observed between diets.
population_specificity: 25 hyperlipidemic subjects

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of an almond-enriched low-calorie diet versus a complex carbohydrate-enriched diet on weight loss and metabolic parameters in overweight and obese adults.
results_summary: The almond-enriched diet led to significantly greater reductions in weight/BMI, waist circumference, fat mass, and systolic blood pressure compared to the carbohydrate-enriched diet. Both diets improved metabolic markers, but the almond group showed more pronounced benefits in weight loss and certain metabolic parameters.
population_specificity: Overweight and obese adults (age 27-79, BMI 27-55 kg/m²).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate alternative treatment strategies combining initial disinfestation and protective treatments to control postharvest insect populations in almonds and raisins, as an alternative to chemical fumigation.
results_summary: The initial disinfestation treatment was effective against navel orangeworm and raisin moth, while all three protective treatments (cold storage, controlled atmosphere storage, and Indianmeal moth granulosis virus application) prevented damaging Indianmeal moth populations. Product quality was maintained at industry-acceptable levels for all protective treatments.
population_specificity: Almonds and raisins (commodities) exposed to laboratory populations of postharvest insects.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of whole almonds versus almond oil on plasma lipids and LDL oxidation in healthy individuals.
results_summary: Both whole almonds and almond oil significantly decreased plasma triglyceride, total cholesterol, and LDL cholesterol while increasing HDL cholesterol, with no difference between the two forms. Neither treatment affected LDL oxidizability.
population_specificity: 22 normolipemic men and women
effective_dosage: Half of habitual fat intake replaced (approximately 14% of 29% total energy intake)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the protective effects of Aloe vera extract on histopathological alterations in vital organs of obese diabetic rats induced by streptozotocin.
results_summary: Aloe vera treatment reversed most histopathological changes in the pancreas, kidney, liver, and adipocytes caused by streptozotocin, including restoring islet cells, reducing β-cell damage, aiding kidney tubular regeneration, and decreasing adipocyte size and macrophage infiltration.
population_specificity: Obese WNIN/GR-Ob rats made diabetic with streptozotocin.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of aloe vera as a topical treatment for oral lichen planus (OLP) lesions compared to turmeric and ashwagandha.
results_summary: The study found that aloe vera, along with turmeric and ashwagandha, showed considerable improvement in reducing burning sensation, lesion size, and pain in OLP patients after 4 months of follow-up. It was concluded that aloe vera could be a useful alternative topical medication for OLP, especially for patients unresponsive to corticosteroids.
population_specificity: Thirty patients with histologically confirmed symptomatic OLP with gingival presentation.
effective_dosage: Topical application twice a day (specific amount not mentioned).
study_duration: 3 weeks of treatment, with follow-up at 4 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the anticancer activity of honey and Aloe vera solution and its ethanolic extraction through in vitro and in vivo approaches.
results_summary: The study found that honey and Aloe vera solution (HA) affected Walker tumor cell viability at the highest dose, while the ethanolic extraction (E) showed stronger cytotoxic/antiproliferative effects in MCF-7 and Walker-256 cells. In vivo results indicated higher survival rates in Walker-256 tumor-bearing rats treated with HA, with increased NK cell infiltration in tumor tissue.
population_specificity: Walker-256 tumor-bearing rats and MCF-7 cancer cells.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a bi-layered nanofibrous scaffold containing Aloe vera and litchi honey could enhance wound healing in diabetic wounds by managing blood glucose, inflammation, and oxidative stress.
results_summary: The scaffold with Aloe vera demonstrated enhanced skin cell proliferation, anti-bacterial and anti-diabetic properties, and superior wound healing with quicker scar-free recovery compared to conventional treatment.
population_specificity: Diabetic wounds (chronic, hard-to-heal wounds in diabetic conditions).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the therapeutic efficacy of Aloe vera-coated curcumin encapsulated nanoparticles in mitigating Alzheimer's disease progression in mice.
results_summary: The nanoformulation showed good stability, significantly improved learning capacity and memory in Alzheimer-induced mice, and demonstrated biochemical and cognitive benefits within 7 days.
population_specificity: Alzheimer-induced mice model

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a new bioactive wound dressing using chitosan-based membranes incorporating Aloe vera glycolic extract and silver nanoparticles, evaluating its physicochemical properties and antimicrobial activity.
results_summary: The study confirmed the successful synthesis of flexible, translucent chitosan-based membranes with Aloe vera and silver nanoparticles, demonstrating antimicrobial activity against Escherichia coli and Staphylococcus aureus, along with favorable swelling and degradation profiles.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of incorporating aloe vera gel into mixed orange and carrot probiotic juices on phytochemical quality, sensory attributes, and antidiabetic efficacy in diabetic rats.
results_summary: Aloe vera enhanced phytochemical quality, increased phenolic and flavonoid content, improved blood glucose and lipid profiles in diabetic rats, and maintained viable probiotic counts in juices. The optimal blend was 75% orange juice, 20% carrot juice, and 5% aloe vera gel.
population_specificity: Diabetic albino rats
effective_dosage: 5% aloe vera gel in juice blend
study_duration: 14-day storage period for juice analysis; intervention duration in rats not specified

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the synergistic effects of Aloe vera and tea polyphenols coatings on preserving the quality and modulating ripening in stored passion fruits.
results_summary: The ALV + TP composite coating significantly reduced weight loss, shrinkage, and decay while enhancing firmness, delaying ethylene production, and activating key metabolic pathways linked to phenolic acid and flavonoid biosynthesis.
population_specificity: "Golden" passion fruit (Passiflora spp.) stored at 10°C.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of Aloe vera, alone and in combination with ithmid kohl or zinc-oxide nanoparticles, in treating bacterial endophthalmitis in rabbits.
results_summary: The study found that Aloe vera gel alone (Group F) was less effective than the combination treatments (Groups B and C), with the ithmid kohl/ZnONPs formulation showing the highest efficacy. In vitro antibacterial assays confirmed these findings, though Aloe vera alone was not the most effective treatment.
population_specificity: 24 healthy adult male albino rabbits infected with Klebsiella pneumoniae.
effective_dosage: 1 ml of Aloe vera gel (Group F).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the antibacterial activity of Aloe vera gel and crude ethanol leaf extract against Staphylococcus aureus and Enterobacterales isolated from wound infections.
results_summary: Aloe vera ethanol leaf extract showed significant antibacterial effects against both S. aureus and Enterobacterales, while the gel did not exhibit any inhibitory effects. The extract's mean MIC and MBC values indicated varying potency against the tested bacterial strains.
population_specificity: Bacteria (Staphylococcus aureus and Enterobacterales) isolated from wound infections.
effective_dosage: Mean MIC for S. aureus was 94 ± 41.23 mg/ml; for Enterobacterales, 45.6 ± 20 mg/ml. Mean MBC for S. aureus was 188 ± 82.46 mg/ml; for Enterobacterales, 91.18 ± 40 mg/ml.
study_duration: 7 months (study duration, not intervention length specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether combining aloe vera gel with 10% urea cream reduces the severity of hand-foot syndrome (HFS) in patients taking capecitabine compared to urea cream alone.
results_summary: The combination of aloe vera gel and urea cream significantly reduced the incidence of grade 2-3 HFS (13.3% vs. 35.5%) compared to urea cream alone, though no significant difference in quality of life (DLQI) was observed.
population_specificity: Patients with rectal cancer (majority) and other cancers taking capecitabine.
effective_dosage: Aloe vera gel combined with 10% urea cream (specific dosage not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the antibacterial and wound-healing effects of a combined gel of cinnamon oil and aloe vera (COVA) in chronic wounds, particularly in diabetic conditions.
results_summary: The COVA gel demonstrated significant antibacterial activity against Pseudomonas aeruginosa and Staphylococcus aureus, accelerated wound closure (79% contraction), increased collagen content and antioxidant capacity, and reduced oxidative stress markers compared to controls.
population_specificity: Diabetic rats with excision wounds.
effective_dosage: Minimum inhibitory concentrations of CO + AV were 100 µg/ml for P. aeruginosa and 200 µg/ml for S. aureus.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of Aloe vera on preventing and treating radiotherapy-induced oral mucositis in head-and-neck cancer patients.
results_summary: Aloe vera mouthwash significantly reduced the severity of oral mucositis in weeks 4-6 of radiotherapy compared to placebo, though no difference was observed in the first 3 weeks.
population_specificity: 75 patients with head-and-neck cancer undergoing radiotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the impact of acemannan (an Aloe vera extract) on the proliferation of dental pulp stem cells (DPSCs) in vitro and its effect on healing mandibular defects in rabbits.
results_summary: Acemannan significantly reduced the population doubling time of DPSCs (29.8 h vs. 45.9 h in controls) and accelerated osteogenesis and healing in mandibular defects when combined with DPSCs.
population_specificity: Male rabbits with mandibular defects and in vitro dental pulp stem cells (DPSCs).
effective_dosage: 8 mg/mL (in vitro), 20 µL of cell suspension containing 10⁶ DPSCs treated with acemannan (in vivo).
study_duration: 24-hour treatment in vitro, 60-day follow-up in vivo.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of Aloe vera extract on oxidative stress, blood-brain barrier permeability, and neurological outcomes following traumatic brain injury in rats.
results_summary: Both low and high doses of Aloe vera reduced blood-brain barrier permeability and oxidative stress markers, with the high dose showing more pronounced effects and improving neurological outcomes post-TBI.
population_specificity: Adult male rats with induced traumatic brain injury.
effective_dosage: Low-dose (LA) and high-dose (HA) Aloe vera extract, administered via intraperitoneal injection half an hour after TBI (specific amounts not detailed in abstract).
study_duration: Assessments were made at 5 and 24 hours post-TBI.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of a newly formulated aloe vera cream on scar reduction after alar resection in rhinoplasty patients.
results_summary: The study found that aloe vera cream significantly reduced scar formation compared to Face Doux cream, as measured by lower PSAQ and VSS scores at two weeks, two months, and six months post-intervention. The results were both statistically and clinically significant.
population_specificity: Patients who underwent external wedge resection during rhinoplasty (n=31 in the aloe vera group, n=29 in the control group).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the clinical efficacy of Aloe vera mouthwash with probiotic, povidone-iodine, and chlorhexidine mouthwashes in treating gingivitis.
results_summary: Aloe vera mouthwash showed a significant reduction in plaque and bleeding scores, though it was less effective than probiotic and chlorhexidine mouthwashes but comparable to povidone-iodine.
population_specificity: 40 patients with gingivitis from an outpatient department, divided into 4 groups of 10 each.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of Alantel®, an Aloe Vera-based cream, in reducing the incidence of radiation-induced dermatitis in women with breast cancer undergoing radiation therapy.
results_summary: The study found that Alantel® significantly reduced the incidence of radiation-induced dermatitis (71.4% vs. 91.4% in the control group) and improved quality of life related to skin condition. The results were statistically significant (p < 0.031).
population_specificity: Women with breast cancer undergoing radiation therapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the antibacterial activity of Aloe vera-loaded chitosan nanoparticles against Staphylococcus aureus and their potential to mitigate S. aureus-induced acute lung injury in rats.
results_summary: The study found that Aloe vera-loaded chitosan nanoparticles exhibited potent bactericidal effects (MIC: 5 µg/ml, MBC: 10 µg/ml) and reduced inflammation by downregulating TLR2 and TLR4 mRNA expression in S. aureus-infected rats. Histological analysis supported the nanoparticles' therapeutic potential in alleviating lung injury.
population_specificity: Rats with S. aureus-induced acute lung injury.
effective_dosage: Not specified (concentration-based: 5-10 µg/ml for antibacterial assays).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of a combination of Aloe barbadensis leaf extract and trimethylglycine to regulate AQP3 expression in skin keratinocytes and improve deep skin hydration.
results_summary: The combination significantly increased AQP3 levels by up to 380% compared to controls and improved skin hydration in clinical trials after one use and over 28 days. The formulation showed a good cytotoxicity profile and synergistic effects.
population_specificity: Healthy volunteers (clinical research) and HaCaT keratinocyte cell culture (in vitro).
effective_dosage: Maximum tolerated doses were 24.50% for Aloe barbadensis leaf extract and 39.00% for trimethylglycine; the final complex used a 1:1 mass ratio.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the combined effect of Aloe vera gel (AVG) and red grape pomace powder (RGP) on growth performance, physiological traits, welfare indicators, and meat quality in densely stocked broilers.
results_summary: The study found that 1% AVG in drinking water combined with 30 g RGP/kg diet improved weight gain and feed conversion ratio (FCR) in broilers, but higher AVG doses did not enhance performance. The GPA2 group showed the lowest gait score, indicating better welfare.
population_specificity: Two-week-old male Ross 308 broilers stocked at high density (30 birds per cage).
effective_dosage: 1%, 2%, 3%, or 4% AVG in drinking water, combined with 30 g RGP/kg diet.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether the co-application of Cr-tolerant Pseudomonas aeruginosa CKQ9 and nano zerovalent iron (nZVI) could enhance the phytoremediation potential of Aloe vera under chromium (Cr) contamination.
results_summary: The co-application significantly improved plant attributes (height, root area, leaves, gel content) and antioxidant activities while reducing Cr concentration in soil and plant tissues, enhancing phytoremediation efficiency.
population_specificity: Aloe vera (Aloe barbadensis L.) grown in Cr-contaminated soil.
effective_dosage: 15 mg kg-1 Cr contamination level maintained in soil.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the therapeutic effects of Aloe vera gel on ethanol-induced gastric ulcers in rats and explore the underlying mechanisms involved.
results_summary: Aloe vera treatment improved gastric ulcer symptoms by modulating oxidant/antioxidant status, exhibiting anti-secretory properties, and mitigating pyroptosis, as evidenced by reduced ulcer index, improved biochemical markers, and histopathological recovery.
population_specificity: Male Wistar rats

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of aloe vera gel (30%) as an edible coating, alone and combined with chitosan, in preserving the quality and extending the shelf life of blue honeysuckle during cold storage.
results_summary: Aloe vera gel coating (30%) improved firmness, antioxidant capacity, and metabolite preservation in blue honeysuckle, with the combined chitosan-aloe vera treatment showing superior effects, including a 1.43-fold increase in FRAP-reducing power compared to the control.
population_specificity: Blue honeysuckle fruit stored at -1 °C.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how ultrasonic treatment affects the physical and chemical properties of vacuum-impregnated apples using Aloe vera juice, focusing on bioactive compound preservation.
results_summary: Ultrasound pre-treatment, particularly at 45 kHz for 20-30 minutes, improved the preservation of bioactive compounds (vitamin C and TPC) compared to vacuum impregnation alone, though the VI process still reduced their content. The treatment did not significantly affect the color of the samples.
population_specificity: Apple slices (in vitro study, no human subjects)
effective_dosage: Not specified (Aloe vera juice solution used for vacuum impregnation)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether Alantel cream, containing natural products at high concentrations, is more effective than a standard moisturizing cream for preventing and treating radiation-induced dermatitis in breast cancer patients.
results_summary: The study protocol outlines a rigorous clinical trial design to compare Alantel cream with a control moisturizer, focusing on the incidence of mild post-radiation dermatitis. Results are pending as the study was delayed by the COVID-19 pandemic.
population_specificity: Breast cancer patients receiving radiotherapy.
study_duration: 15 days of radiotherapy treatment, with follow-up for up to 1 week post-treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of aloe vera powder incorporated into denture soft lining materials in reducing candida adherence compared to chitosan and a control group.
results_summary: Aloe vera powder significantly reduced candida growth (mean value 41.15) compared to chitosan (16.05) and the control group (79.1), demonstrating superior efficacy (P value = 0.001). Both herbal agents were effective, but aloe vera was more effective than chitosan.
population_specificity: Soft denture lining material samples (in vitro study).
effective_dosage: Not specified (powder form incorporated into material).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the physico-chemical properties of alginate-aloe vera raft-forming systems for potential use in treating gastro-esophageal reflux disorders.
results_summary: Aloe vera improved raft volume, buoyancy, strength, resilience, reflux resistance, and acid neutralization capacity compared to formulations without it. The study demonstrated that alginate-aloe vera rafts are suitable for reflux treatment.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)
effective_dosage: 1% and 1.5% aloe vera in raft suspensions

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if polyphenol antioxidant (PA) supplementation improves exercise performance in the heat by altering cardiovascular and thermoregulatory responses.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in exercise performance, cardiovascular or thermoregulatory responses between PA and placebo groups, indicating PA supplementation had no impact on these outcomes.
population_specificity: Twelve endurance-trained athletes
